thread.title: Chadds Ford tech firm secures $1.85 million in venture capital
thread.title_full: Chadds Ford tech firm secures $1.85 million in venture capital

author: Harold Brubaker,
title: Chadds Ford tech firm secures $1.85 million in venture capital
text:
DecisionSim Inc. of Chadds Ford received $1.85 million from investors in its initial round of fundraising, the company said Wednesday.
Rittenhouse Venture, a Philadelphia venture capital firm, contributed $1.5 million and Ben Franklin Technology Centers of Southeastern Pennsylvania invested $385,000.
DecisionSim, which was founded in 2010, will use the money to expand its workforce and contractors from 25 to 35 or 40 and to pay for technology upgrades, said chief executive Bob Yayac.
DecisionSim's primary product is a simulator for the health-care industry that allows employees to practice skills with the help of a built-in "coach," Yayac said.
The Veterans Administration, one of DecisionSim's major clients, is using DecisionSim to train physicians in how to deal with an influx of female veterans, Yayac said. The VA is also starting to use the system to educate patients, he said.
